laboratory_examinations.findings: Hyperkeratosis, acanthosis, neutrophilic microabscesses deep in the epidermis, dense mixed inflammatory cell infiltrate in the dermis with focal multinucleated giant cells.
Hyperkeratosis, parakeratosis, irregular acanthosis, neutrophilic epidermal microabscesses, spongiform pustules, and a mononuclear perivascular infiltrate in the papillary dermis.
Intense acute and chronic inflammation in the stroma.
Weakly positive Chlamydia trachomatis serology (IgG positive 1:16, IgM positive 1:10), IgM positive 1:10 for Chlamydia psittaci and Chlamydia pneumoniae, suggesting probable cross-reactivity.
Increased platelet count (667,000/mm³), white blood cell count (12.9 k/mm³).
Normal or negative results including liver function tests.
